title: Trash app, trash hardware.
text:
Do not waste your money on this. The app is trash, as is the product itself.

The concept: You don't need a key! You simply touch the lock to lock and unlock it (while in proximity of your phone with the app)

The reality: It rarely works.

Sometimes, I'll tap the lock, the lights'll spin for a few seconds and nothing happens. Then I do it again. Same result. After about 4 tries, I'll finally pull out my key and lock the door manually.

It WILL work when you don't want it to. I'll go out to check the mail and my hand will lightly brush the deadbolt and it'll activate. Or, it'll work when I've given up on it and finally pull my key out and it'll activate just as I go to put my key in the lock after standing there like a goon for 2 minutes trying to get it to work. Or, worse yet, it'll activate just because my key or finger touched the lock as I was inserting my key, sometimes creating an error when it tries to lock it after I just unlocked it (or vice versa).

Why couldn't this work when I need it to and have my hands full with groceries (coming home) or the items I need for work (leaving)? Nope. Only works effortlessly when I don't need it to at all.

It's literally the worst. I don't know if there are better options out there, but it's impossible to have worse options. Avoid at all costs.

The only reasons it gets two stars are because (a) you can’t rate it lower and (b), at the very least if you have your phone, you’ll never be locked out.

title: Works fine, overburdened with notifications
text: This app does what it says it’s going to do. But there are waaaay too many notifications. I don’t need a notification when I turn Bluetooth off, and I don’t need a notification when I close the app. I know that the app needs to be open to use its functionality. That’s pretty much what all apps do. The only notifications that are necessary are (1) your door is unlocked and (2) your door is locked. Forcing me to deal with extra worthless notifications (and giving me no way to turn them off) is annoying.

title: 5/5 worthy app BUT.....
text: It’s a great app, works exactly as you would imagine and has incredibly easy setup. HOWEVER after a while it starts bugging you with pop ups for feedback every. Single. Time. You open the app. Wanna unlock your door? Gotta let them know if you love Kevo first or not. You cannot bypass it to lock or unlock your door, so you had better not hope there’s a time-sensitive emergency happening. It doesn’t even matter if your answer is yes or no, the prompts will keep coming. They don’t even ask you to leave feedback on the App Store or their website to make it stop. I’m only leaving this review here in hopes that it will stop because at this point I’m worried it will be a safety concern. Please Kevo, my answer is yes for now, but it will not be forever if you don’t stop asking me every time I open your app.

title: Thank you Developers
text: I just wanted to say thank you to the developers for continuing to support this wonderful device and app. I know that the support of newer phone models has been a sticking point for a lot of reviews, but, as long as we can continue using our standard issue currently supported iPhones with this lock — seamlessly — I will be a happy customer. Reliability of unlocking with my new iPhone in my pocket recently has been flakey, (have to open the Kevo app on phone for it to “trigger” my touch on the physical lock), but I hope that I can continue to use the lock for many more years to come before support is ultimately dropped per eventual demise of all technology things in this world.

title: Unable to operate the Kevo lock without numerous tries
text:
More than 90 percent of the time, I am unable to lock or unlock my 1st gen Kevo lock on the first try (by touching the lock). Sometimes, restarting the Kevo app would work but most of the time, it does not. When the Kevo app is able to get the actual status (locked or unlocked) of the lock, it is possible to use the app the operate the lock but that usually takes a while and sometimes require restating the app. I also have Kevo Plus and when I am unable to operate the lock by touching the lock, and when Kevo app is taking too long to recognize the lock, I would resort to using Kevo Plus to operate the lock.

Because these issues started quite a few years ago, my wife has completely given up on using the “smart” feature of the Kevo and has switched back to using a physical key.

title: Does what it needs to do but with security concerns.
text: The app back when the kevo contemporary came out was amazing and I’ve had it since day 1; however, after a few updates the app has introduced new bugs. The worst bug being the two factor authentication. The idea behind 2FA is to use FaceID or a pin to unlock / lock the kevo. It doesn’t work that way and it’s a huge security issue. If you open the app it just goes straight to the lock and you can unlock the front door just by touching the screen. No 2FA needed. This is just one of the inherent vulnerabilities found on the app. The lock is great don’t get me wrong but the app on the other hand isn’t. Also, just don’t take my word for it. Try it yourself. You definitely should not trust a Cybersecurity Expert in the reviews section of an app.

text:

It takes forever for the lock to work and it sounds like a grinding machine (seriously like a key being made in the grinder).  I wish I could submit an audio. To top it off, my lock started flashing red and orange (new batteries were installed 3 weeks ago). Obviously this killed all functionality of the unit. I had to remove and reinstall software to get the flashing and functionality back. Now if I could get it to work like it did before the last update, I might consider keeping it.
Mechanical warranty is only 1 year. Companies solution after malfunction ( 14 months). “Disconnect electronics, take batteries out and use it as a regular lock. “. Seriously, after spending more than$200. That was their solution.

title: Sometimes works perfect, sometimes
text: I have had the app and lock a few months. I love the lock but it does have a learning curve. When I first set up the lock with my phone I set the proximity too close meaning I often had to pull my phone out and hold it close to the lock. When I purchased the gateway I reset everything including my proximity a good arms length away (I'm 6'2") and now I can touch my lock and activate it farther away, not usually a problem. The added benefit is leaving the house and not always have to be facing the lock and waiting for it to lock. But sometimes I still do. I have noticed if my phone is in my pocket and screen is facing my body, I need to be very close to the lock. This may be due to my heavy protective case. Another thing I've noticed about the lock, sometimes I touch it and it doesn't sense that I did. After making sure I didn't turn into a vampire, I learned that if I rub my fingers quickly and touch the lock it senses them. I don't have particularly cold hands often. I'm happy with how the app functions but haven't updated my phone to latest iOS because I heard it doesn't work as well yet. I don't use my fobs so no input there. I hope to see this lock system grow and expand features, not sure what more I want yet though.

title: I like it very much!
text:
We’ve had very few problems, and the advantages this system has provided far outweigh the occasional glitches. I guess I’m old fashioned, but I rarely allow myself to be 100% dependent on ANY technology. That means I am delighted when it works, which is most of the time, and never frustrated by rare failure.

I have discovered a consistent vulnerability that I have not seen identified in the reviews here yet. If you use the iPhone’s bluetooth for any other task, such as music at home, Kevo seems to lose its control of bluetooth every time, even though “sharing” is active. Other apps are not “sharing” at all, just taking over completely. If I turn off bluetooth after use, “force quit” Kevo in background, then re-launch everything, it restores reliable Kevo function. (My husband uses an Apple watch, so he has given up using Kevo entirely.)

None of that changes my opinion that Kevo is a great household tool. I think the person who used it for commercial application is an idiot - there are digital combination deadbolts that can be programmed for multiple users, that are more secure, robust, and reliable. You should really consult a professional locksmith when you have business/commercial lock needs.

title: Worst Device I Have Ever Bought
text: I bought the Kevo because I was sold on the idea that I would no longer need a key as long as I had my phone in my pocket, worst decision I've ever made I should have just tossed $200 out the window as I drove down the freeway. More times than not I'm left standing at my door staring at the blue ring spin and spin time after time until I finally pull my phone out of my pocket and open the app, so that I can finally get into my house. Now this app is supposed to work as long as it remains open in the background but that is about as dependable as the weather man. It might work but it's probably not going to and if it's poring rain you can bet your life it's not going to work. Now I guess every time I come home I could pull my phone from my pocket and open the app, but seems to me if that were the case it would be just as easy to use a key and certainly cheaper than buying a lock that cost $200. To make matters worse the lock never seems to fail after you've unlocked the door and are walking in, because if you accidentally bump the lock it will lock and the exposed bolt then slams into the molding around the door as you close it, dinging it up really nice for you. If I could give you any advice it would be leave this lock at the store and save your money, and if you've just bought it pack it up and take it back.

title: Does what it's supposed to when it actually works

It's more an annoyance than anything else.  But at the same time what's the point of having this great lock if I still need to reach into my pocket on a random basis to get my phone and unlock THAT first just to get the app working again and unlock my door?  Easier to just use a key at that point.  FIX THIS PLEASE.

Second thing - why is there no BOTTOM lock from Kēvo or pretty much any vendor?   I just don't understand that.  I have an upper lock and a lower lock but I can only automatically unlock the upper lock.  So what, I should always leave my lower lock unlocked just so I don't need to use a key when this thing actually works?  MAKE A LOWER LOCK (door handle) KĒVO!

title: Slow, but it works.
text: Okay. So the physical product is good. Very handy. Sometimes the lock is slow to detect the phone which require 2-3 touches of the lock. Occasionally I have to shut down the app and reopen it for it to work. The Kevo Plus seems to work pretty consistently for me. Pretty consistently slow that is. My app takes time to refresh the current status of the lock. Often I have to shut down the app, too. Other than some slow connectivity issues, it works well. I have never been locked out of my house due to it now working. Actually, one time I left my phone in the house and my wife locked the door with her phone as we both left. I forgot something and had to go back. I was locked out. I was able to call my wife from my Apple Watch and she remotely unlocked the door. It would be nice to have a native app on the watch that could serve as a key too. Currently, it is only able to view and interact with alerts that come directly from the phone. Overall, I do like the lock. We pre-ordered and have been happy customers since. I would give this a better rating if the connections were quicker, first-time and if there was a native Apple Watch app.

title: Wish I could rate in negative numbers.
text:
Not only has the app and Kēvo lock become worse as the versions progress, it has become virtually useless at this point. The app is slow and clunky, taking longer to open, locate, and connect to the lock than it would take for me to fish out keys from the bottom of my black-hole of a purse, fumble with my arm full of whatever, and turn the key in the lock. Not good for rainy days, or late evenings, or running from that horror-movie monster chasing you. It is frustrating that the app has to be actively open on your phone to function which completely negates the point of a touch-lock. Now, I must be holding my open phone to unlock my door which leaves me with yet one more thing to fumble with. Leaving the app open in the background is no good either, unless of course you're one of the billions of people with a smartphone that never actually uses it and can afford to feed the majority of your battery life to your battery-hungry Kēvo app. 
I'm sad to say, I only ever use my actual key now. I'd rather not spend several minutes (NOT an exaggeration) waiting on my doorstep for the lock to work. Kēvo had a promising premise, exceedingly poor execution.

Nice to not have to fumble for my keys with my hands full while trying to get in my house.

title: Battery Drain and Inconsistent
text: While the updates are appreciated, this still needs some serious improvement. Kevo (Gen. 2) has never been 100% reliable for me, but it does work a lot of the time...still needs improvement though.  However, with this update specifically, I've experienced serious battery drain on my iPhone 7 Plus. Having the Kevo app in the background has never been a big drain on my battery before, but now it's consistently the #1 app under battery usage. Not good! Kevo has so much potential...please fix whatever is causing me to have to try 4+ times to unlock before finally getting the green ring...and whatever is causing the major battery drain in this version.  I have contacted support in the past with issues and only get a generic response with instructions on how to reset the Kevo (which I did, no help.)  I'm disappointed that I held out for the second generation which was supposed to be faster and more reliable, but unfortunately I have to use my physical key quite a bit.  Please keep improving the app and firmware.

title: Good - a bit quirky
text:
Overall it's a good lock. Support has been really great on it so far. It does take a bit for the lock to realize the iPhone, but other than that I'm glad I don't need to "carry" a bunch of keys anymore. I just want to add that the app can be finicky. Even though I have the app open it wants my phone right next to it and I have to reopen the app.  Other times my phone can be asleep and in my pocket and work just fine. 

With the iOS 11, it’s been nothing short of a nightmare in hopes it works. I have deleted and reinstalled app countless times just hoping it work be sustainable. And when I close my apps I hope I do t close Kevo while it is deciding to work, cause if I close it, the app stops working when I reopen it causing me to delete reinstall, rinse and repeat.  It’s quite distracting for cool tech. But all I get is Kevo blames Apple, Apple blames Kevo.

Update:  what I find is that when you phone is asleep, for me in my holster, it may not recognize it. If it doesn’t then I have to reach in open the app and watch the app update and then hope it will unlock.

title: Horrible app bad connectivity
text: I had this product for a week and regret wasting my time and energy. I was really excited about this because I hoped it would be a solution to my teenage son constantly forgetting his key at home and being locked out. I also liked the idea of not having to dig in my purse at night to find my keys to get inside my house. Set up was a nightmare when it came to my sons phone he was never able to accept the key I sent him, I kept getting an error saying no internet connection both on LTE and wifi, only when I set him up as the owner did his phone work which was unacceptable. I tried to send my mom a key just to test it on a second device and had the exact same issues. It only worked on mine and my husbands phones. I also didn't like that I always had to pull my phone out of my pocket wait minutes for the phone to find the lock and then press the button on my phone to unlock the door, it just took way to long. I am returning it and going with a keypad lock instead that a friend has and loves. Overall I loved the idea of this product but it did not meet my expectations or my needs.

title: Poor rollout, great update
text:
The latest app update was supposed to make the communication between phone and lock better and it has. However, in order for app to work better and not worse, the firmware on the lock itself needs to be updated. The only problem is they did a fazed update and the new app was available a week before the firmware was and for that one week I seriously considered returning the lock I was having so many problems. Now after having updated the firmware it's working great. The communication between the lock and phone is fast and smooth. 
One other note, I read another reviewer was having problems with the lock locking without being touched when the door was open. I was having the same problem and it turns out the small cable had become frayed which caused a short that led to the random locking. I called customer service and they arranged an exchange for my lock. The new lock is working like a dream.

title: Over two years.. still having issues
text:
I installed this device/app because i thought it was a good idea and my wife and kids could get in/out fairly quickly. It worked well for some time, but we’ve always had issues with the locking/unlocking and not sure why. Even with all the updates, new batteries this still does not work. We just got back from vacation, and could not get into our house!! The app says to make sure Bluetooth was on and of course it was! This really was frustrating. Glad that we gave a physical key to our neighbor to check on our pet while gone. Without our physical key we were locked out of our own home!

Please get this fixed!! I will most likely be removing this from our home as this is too great a risk with not being able to get in as well as the door just locking/unlocking by itself. Yes I’ve calibrated the way the documentation states and this still does not help. Maybe with this new update things will be different. 

All I’ve seen are issues with this product as well as others having the same challenges... not very good service at all.

title: Seriously?
text:
The last two updates has left my 1st gen lock almost unusable. About 98% of the time now, I have to take my phone out and launch the app for the lock to detect my phone. It worked previously. Is this a deliberate break to get me to upgrade to the 2nd gen lock?  I have two locks at different locations and have experienced the same frustration. I have tried recalibration and re-setting the locks with no hope of a fix. It is very frustrating and now I'm at the point where I would have better off just using a regular keyed lock. Kwikset, please fix this. I find it very hard to recommend your product now that it is so unreliable.

Update: I’ve called the customer support number, had both locks replaced and the same issues persist. Kēvo keeps releasing software for the app to improve reliability but this latest app update today makes no difference. I called the customer support line and was told all they can do is walk me through resetting the lock. What a waste of $400. Kwikset should be ashamed of this product and I will never but another kwikset lock. Buyers beware.

title: Good in theory, not in practice
text:
I am a mom, so most days when I leave the house I resemble a human pack mule. Besides my gazillion bags I am usually chasing a toddler and carrying my work bag, purse, toddler bag, sippy cup, snacks, and the lil man himself. Yes I realize I could make multiple trips to the car to load everything but multiple trips to the car is for suckers and people with time management skills. Probably not the key demographic for this lock. So when the option to tap the lock to lock my door was available I jumped on it. Except it almost never works. Even with the app always running in the background I either have to take out my phone and open the lock, then tap in to the lock in my account to make it work. This in itself is a lot more time consuming than just taking my key out. Even with all this fumbling this still only makes the lock work, as it should, a handful of times. The plus side? My toddler’s patience level while I try to lock the door has improved tenfold. 

I will say, when it does work. It. Is. Glorious.

title: Finally!
text:
Addendum: iOS 11 has been out for a few days, and it’s become sorely obvious that Kevo didn’t make much of an attempt to stay current. Since updating to the new iOS, I now have to take my phone out of my pocked and quit the app & restart it TWICE—EVERY TIME—before the Kevo will lock or unlock!!!! Please get on top of this new issue!!!

Original Review:
I was about to rip out my Kevo locks because of the VERY slow response time to lock and unlock recently, but finally after the Kevo app's most recent upgrade along with iOS's most recent upgrade, the wait time is back to where it was — pretty fast response.
Kevo: stop pretending that all is well in your generic responses to our inquiries and be upfront, explaining what the problems are, and we might be more understanding— You weren't the ones getting stuck in the rain impatiently waiting for your door to unlock. title: Good, but could be better.
text: If they let me do half stars I'd give 3.5. Works good, sometimes it locks itself before you get in the house so you have to unlock it before closing the door and manually lock it back after entering. Other times it doesn't lock behind me at all and I have to lock it manually or with the app or it will stay unlocked. Works good if you don't take for granted that it will be perfect - it won't, so just check behind yourself to make sure and you'll be fine. Also, they are just using the exact same logo as the band 'the germs' that have been around forever. Every time I see the logo I think of the germs and always will, since they had it first. A note on another review I saw... It isn't homeKIT compatible yet, but I don't have home kit and the app DID let us name our phones/fobs and keep track of who entered when, as well as allowing us to only allow limited windows of entry for certain individuals (like if you air bnb or have a cleaning service).

title: Doesn’t work well
text:
For the cost of this lock, plus the cost of having a handy man assemble this to the office door of my business, is not worth the cost. 
Me, the bartender, and two of my managers all have access to be able to unlock office door to our business with their smart phones, so they can cash out servers or to get change for registers, or get bottles of liquor. The staff is so upset they decided to use the key instead. Every time I have my Kēvo app open and touch the Kēvo door part, it doesn’t even open more than 70% of the time. So I have to kill the app, restart Kēvo and then touch the knob for the darn thing to work. It’s very aggravating. The company needs to fix the major bug issues that is preventing it from working the way it needs to be. The whole reason why I bought this is because so I don’t have to carry keys around and just use my phone since I have it always with me anyway. I Got this to make my life easier and it barely works. Very disappointing. I wish they can do something to fix this once and for all. They need to speed this thing up 

Thank you

title: Just not reliable
text:
This is a review of the lock more so than just the app considering their inseparable. 

When this works it's great. Sadly though it rarely works as advertised. More often than not, we have to touch the lock twice or even three times to trigger the lock or unlock. Even holding my phone next to the lock. Totally defeats the purpose as it's actually more convenient to pull out a key than to fumble with my phone tapping the lock a couple of times waiting 10 or 15 seconds each time. 

Distance lock/unlock is worthless. Have to be so close and it takes so long to actually connect, authenticate, and move the lock it would be much faster just to walk over and use a key. 

Lack of z-wave connectivity is also a gap. 

Overall, you can tell this is a solution developed by a legacy company that has never had to think forward with respect to tech. Half way there. Fix the connectivity issues, fix the distance limitations, and incorporate z-wave and this would be a killer lock. Sadly, as an early adopter and still waiting like 2 years, I have low confidence this will be updated. I was optimistic when I saw the lock was recently "improved" but customer service couldn't tell me any more detail other than what was on the package as to what was actually changed. 

My recommendation is to skip this lock for at least another generation. Go with one of the smaller more forward thinking companies for the foreseeable future.

title: Reliable lock
text:
App needs much improvement but the security mechanism is very precise. I am much satisfied with this product. 

Nick R

I am reading many reviews and I do agree with some on certain issues. 
First of all keep in mind that nothing is totally perfect yet and never will be. To fully follow and to understand instructions is important. The lock works very well just as it should. As far as being slow when opening and closing that is normal and precisely correct. In fact sometimes I have to tap the lock more than once for it in order to lock/unlock. This tells me that the system/app is communicating with the key (my finger). 
You wouldn't want the lock to open/close for just anyone who taps /touches the lock. Also the time lapse when closing/opening depends on the wifi/Bluetooth signal strength but the most important OBJECTIVE is that the lock will never falsely operate/function. For me personally this is the only reason why I installed the lock in my house/door. 
I have tried to manipulate the lock and to trick it to open but no way no how I succeeded and that is exactly why I like Kēvo lock even more. 
As for anything in life you cannot please everyone every time and until then take the good with the less good. 

Nick R

title: Gen 1 is a piece of crap!!!
text: I hate your Gen 1 Kēvo Lock so much right now, I want to uninstall it, drive to your headquarters and launch it through your front window.  The connectivity issues with this lock have made it the most unreliable piece of technology I have ever owned.  The whole reason I bought your $200 ripoff was so I didn’t have to reach in the pocket of my jeans and pull out my keys... well, now I have to reach in my jeans, pull out my phone, unlock my phone, open my Kēvo app because it has decided to shut down, hope it eventually syncs up with the lock and lets me into my house.  I’m on an iPhone X with the latest iOS and the Kēvo app is up to date, so don’t even try to blame it on that... title: Annoying app, poorly thought out
text: I did my research before buying. I already knew the Internet gateway 'kevo plus' was an optional $70 add on. I knew 'ekeys' cost $2.00 each. title: Terrible Experience - Please don’t buy this lock!
text:
This is horrific, the “touch-to-unlock” is slow to respond. Often requiring the phone to be pulled out, and the app to be closed and re-opened multiple times before the lock will respond.
This lock has so much potential.. But my god, everything about Kēvo right now is horrible!! Not to mention, on top of it all, for remote control you need a $100 bridge in addition. I’ve just gone back to using the physical key with the lock, it’s faster than this terrible app.
I’m so disappointed in my purchase, and will make sure nobody that I know makes the same mistake in owning this junk. It’s almost 2018, you’d think it wouldn’t be this hard to make a Bluetooth lock work, especially for the price.. Come on, get it together..

title: Good with one big exception ...
text: I've used Kevo for a few years now.  The updates have generally made things better.  This latest update did work really well for me in getting the door open and shut.  However, I have to agree 100% with Konoyei's comment that this latest update is a SERIOUS battery hog.  IPhone 6s.  Yes, did all the typical troublshooting items.  Still 20% to 25% of my battery was going to service Kevo in a 24 hour period.  It's been such an annoyance that's I've totally shut the app off until the next release comes out to test again.  That says a lot as I really, really dislike getting my key out at all.  I have a KeyFob and it is worthless at this point and I don't know how to service it with a new battery (if that is even possible).  Other than that, I love everything about Kevo.  I just can't afford to dedicate a 1/4 of my battery each day to being available for when I use the lock 6 or so times a day.

title: Getting better
text:
Adding a star back now that I don't have to authenticate my email after a phone restart. This is a much better version as far as signing in/remembering your accnt. I do hope I've seen the last of the splash screens giving me a run down of what the app needs because occasionally I do restart my phone...and will find myself outside my door having to wade through everything. I also finally got/made the key blade for my Keyport and learned a physical key can avoid some of the nonsense. But they knew that and said as much early on. As cool as this is, at this point it's still a bad idea to not have a real key. 

I'm saving some stars for when I can put the lock on a network and remote entry it (I feel like remote control was something I expected to be able to do). Or have a week of no unexpected issues outside my office door. 

But, it is getting better. Today I just opened the app and I was logged in. No fuss.

title: Great idea but not ready for the market
text: I bought this in spite of the many reviews I saw and while this is a great idea. It's just not ready for everyday use. The lock overall works well and is easy to install. The issue comes with the app. It signs you out every single day and when you're logged out, the lock won't read you. I also had issues with distance. My phone is always in my pocket so when I tried to lock and unlock it would say it's too far. I'd have to take my phone out and put it close to the lock. This is supposed to be Bluetooth. I'm thinking at least 2-3 feet of distance but you get inches. Once kwikset fixes the app and distance issue, I think would be a nice product. I'd like to see some ability to remotely unlock the door without sending ekeys. In the end I had to return it because it was annoying to stay at the door while I resigned in to lock and unlock the door.

title: So far, so great
text: Set up was very easy if you read the directions carefully - turned off wifi during calibration per others comments and had no issues. The entire lock is metal and well built, w the exception of the back cover - partly plastic. Doesn't look bad now but hope it holds up. For the price point I think you should get a minimum of 5 E-keys vs it being just a promotion.  We have had a couple of instances of walking by the open door and having the door lock, and we get a blink after locking which seems to mean that the bolt is binding slightly (it doesn't seem to be at all) but it is still locking and unlocking smoothly. If it truly works as it seems to (even w phone in a winter coat) it will be terrifically convenient!

title: Works sporadically
text: I had high hopes for this, but it simply doesn't work all the time. I've had to use the hard key more times than I expected to get into my home. I have the plus, too. I hope and expect that the bugs will be worked out - I still think that the concept is great, but for what I paid for the whole package, I expected it to work more consistently. I'm looking forward to see what Kēvo will do to improve and correct these anomalies. It could be user-error, but I didn't think that it was that complicate to use. Just touch the lock and open - instead I get:  touch (nothing), pull out the phone (nothing), touch again... remove case, etc. It does work at times, but am hoping for more consistency. I still believe in this product - and will keep a positive outlook for any future improvements. Don't give up KĒVO it's a great idea. (Future request: voice activation would be nice someday).

title: None
text: I love tech and gadgets. This product only works well when the app is open which defeats the purpose. I have used this for over a year and decided to write a review because I am annoyed on a daily basis. I cannot count the hours I have spent watching the blue ring spin and lock not open. Even when holding my phone in my hand next to the lock I have to hit t multiple times. I have reinstalled the lock to make sure antenna was set correctly and have used it with 4 different generations of iPhones with the same result. Each time they release a new firmware I get excited that it will finally perform was induced but it never does. Again, I love my tech and gadgets but this is something I would not recommend unless you are fine with always getting your phone out and opening the app or alternately, hitting the ring three or four times and waving your phone around. Don't buy it. If you did and now you are getting the app, my condolences.

title: $1.99 for extra keys, really!!!
text: It's really sad to charge so much for a lock and then after you get it they charge $1.99 for extra keys. I understand why they charge me $1.99 for a key at the hardware store because someone has to cut a physical key. Doesn't make sense to charge for a digital one. I also have not been able to calibrate multiple iPhones and one fob. I was able to get one to calibrate but it had to be right next to the lock. The lock works well locking and unlocking. It would be great if you could control the range of the Bluetooth via the app so you could customize it to your environment. Setting up notifications is way too time consuming. You have to set up lock and unlock for each individual user. They need to simplify this by selecting all users. I think the concept of this lock is great and they have paved the way for the future. If they don't make simple changes like NOT charging for eKeys they will lose their edge.

title: Stuck outside my door...
text:
UPDATE: August 29, 2017 - Today I found myself standing in the rain, watching the pretty blue light on the lock spin around and around.  I tried to open the app and use the remote unlock feature contained in it...you know, the one I had to pay an extra $99 for?  Yeah...that didn't work either.  The newest version of the app is just as bad as the old.  At some point I have to face the fact that I wasted $350 on this concept.  Not at all what I would expect from Kwikset.

I'm fortunate that my girlfriend carries a physical key to the house, because this app has gotten progressively worse.  It's at the point that in order for me to get it to work with any reliability, I open the app and hit unlock before I get out of my car...because otherwise I'd be standing outside of my door, looking at the pretty flashing colors telling me that I'm not getting into my house because Kēvo isn't working right anymore.  Not exactly the great investment that I'd hoped it would be.

title: Epic fail on April 9, 2016
text:
Yesterday, the Kevo app experienced a "service degradation" according to an email from Kwikset.  It was nowhere near a degradation, it was a total fail.  The app would load and immediately crash.   This was the first, hopefully only, time in over a year that I've had the lock, but it meant I could not lock/unlock my door, basically the only thing it does of importance to me.  The website FAQ says an Internet connection is not needed to lock/unlock the door, but that appears to be untrue.  A door lock mechanism cannot fail, not even once, and if the phone and lock set are working well (they were) there should never be an inability to perform the most basic design function.  

This apparently means less to the mfr. than to me, given their response.  This coupled with the many and real problems noted by others, renders this a weak solution to a non-problem (lock/unlock a door).  "IoT" = a lot less than meets the eye.

title: Finicky but awesome
text: I am fully onboard with this concept however after living with this lock for 6 months, I have the following observations. Installation is delicate. The lock must be precisely set in order for the bolt to work properly. I have two locks that I cannot use because the lock mechanism is not engaged thus the door does not lock. The one lock that does work is our main door and we love it... Except for the fact that if you just slightly brush the outside lock while the door is open, moving things in or out, the lock will engage and the bolt will extend. All in all we are not satisfied as we had purchased three of these as part of a substantive remodel. This type of lock mechanism is an excellent step forward but the folks at KeVo need to address some of the details in order to sell more locks. App is fine... And to be honest is not that critical.

title: Good idea but has bugs
text:
Updated:
8-2-16
As stated below I really want to like this lock and app and I did move from two stars to three stars, but it isn't going to get
a fourth star from me until I can be confident the door and app work seamlessly. It is still a 50/50 shot on the door unlocking without pulling out my phone and restarting the app or jet using my keys.

title: Great lock, not so great app!
text: The lock is awesome started with just the lock. It was simple to use with Bluetooth, only down fall is with the touch lock you have to have the app open to work, so basically that is useless, if I’m going to have to have the app open, I might as well just open it with the app! I decided to upgrade to the plus, so I can open my lock from anywhere and that worked great, except that it is not compatible with my security system, because the never added z wave support like they announced 3yrs ago that the would. I have to open the app over ten to fifteen times to get it to stay open long enough to lock or unlock my door. This happens constantly! I am about to the point of replacing the lock with another brand. The app needs a major bug overhaul.

title: May as well have flushed that $175
text:
This lock and app were great for about the first week. I have the second generation Kēvo lock. After about a week, I can no longer use touch unlock unless this app is open and physically in view on my iPhone screen, which makes the touch sensor completely obsolete because at that point I could just unlock the door from the app itself. 

Another MAJOR issue is that my door keeps randomly unlocking itself without even being touched. It’s doing this while we are in the living room. I have no idea if it’s doing it while I’m not at home, but if it is, I imagine this is a HUGE liability for your company because it my house gets robbed, I will be coming after YOU and you crap product!!!

I want my $175 back immediately. This is a safety risk for myself, my children and husband, and my home. Not worth it!!!!! Oh and the way you seemingly ignore all of your reviews and complaints is negligent at best. Reflects horribly on your company.

title: Mediocre product and customer service
text:
I purchased the 2nd generation kēvo lock in the fall of 2016. I have some solid experience with the lock and the app at this point. 
The lock - the only positive thing about the lock that functions is the ability to tap the exterior of the deadbolt three times for it to lock. That’s the best feature as it works. The one tap to close and one tap to open dependent on the Bluetooth connectivity with an iOS device is ridiculous. The ring light spins continuously only to time out with no action taken. I’m left standing outside, tapping away like a fool because i refuse to believe i paid $$$ for a lock that won’t function as marketed. 
The app - the solution offered to solve the lack of function of the for the lock is to continuously DELETE AND REINSTALL the app. This would need to occur every week. The most annoying solution ever. 
Customer service - non existent.

title: The most frustrating device that I wanted to Love!
text:
What I like: being able to remotely lock or unlock the door. Not having to get a key out, being able to share a key with someone temporarily. 

What I don't like: it's a 50/50 shot as to whether or not it will sense my phone and unlock with my touch. Often I have to physically get my phone out of my pocket which completely defeats the purpose. I have completed the calibration many times and I often have hold the phone next to lock to get it to work. 

What is even more troubling is the times when we don't have our phone anywhere near the lock (20' +) and have it lock when you bump it walking out of the door. 

We spent the money to get the Kevo plus so we could check the door remotely. This was very difficult to setup on more than one phone and only sporadically gave us an accurate indication of the lock status. One thing that would help is if the the app had a dedicated lock and unlock button. The app has one button that toggles the lock. When you look at it for the lock status remotely and it erroneously says it is unlocked. So you press the button to lock it but in reality now you have unlocked it. I want a button that just says lock door. The lock can make sure it is locked regardless of its current status.

title: Amazing Product, Highly Recommended
text:
Despite all of the negative reviews, I have not had any issues with this lock. As long as Bluetooth is on, all you need to do is tap the lock and it will unlock/lock in a second or two. I don't believe you even need to have the app running in the background but I could be wrong about that.

I keep my iPhone 6s Plus in my front pocket and have never had an issue with the lock not unlocking, and the phone is maybe 3 to 4 feet away from the lock itself.

I've had the lock for a little over a month now and the batteries are still running from what was supplied initially. The setup was fairly straightforward and I was even able to reprogram the lock to use the key that was supplied by my landlord so they still have access and I won't have issues with management.

Most of the negative reviews were from 2014 so it seems that Kevo has really improved the lock in the app and it works flawlessly. I would highly recommend this lock to anyone looking for an automated lock solution as it seems that Kevo has sorted out all the kinks and bugs and it works amazingly.

title: Great gadget for a mom
text: I tell all my mom friends if they want one thing to make their life simpler, this is it. I have two babies under two and unlocking the door with my hands full of babies and groceries or baby gear can be difficult.  But with Kevo I just turn the shoulder with the diaper bag (and my phone) towards the door when I tap the lock and I'm in without having to put the baby down or take my eyes off the toddler. I also like that I can now unlock my front door to let someone (the babysitter, friends for a playdate, grandma) in when I'm busy feeding the baby, changing a diaper, or otherwise unable to get to the door. This might be a great baby shower gift that a new mom didn't even know she should register for!

title: Want to change other doorlock instead of Kevo
text:
I bought this Kevo door lock key several month ago at the Homedepot. It looked new and very convinent door lock.  My husband installed this doorlock almost 4 hours and we found out metal normal key and doorlock key isn't matching at all.  So if we don't have cellphone battery and fob key, we can't open the key. Also doorlock battery out, it will not working with smart phone and fob key. We called Kevo key company and they said they will send an another Kevo product, even we installed 4hours for this door lock key.  We 've been waited new Kevo key, but they did't sent it again. I emailed that company but they said call service center again.  

This Kevo key dosen't working well and so many of errors even if we using normally. I want to change another doorlock but when we installed this Kevo key, our door had so much of demage and cut. So I'm not sure my door working with another kind of doorlock.  I don't recommend this Kevo door lock at all.

title: Sweet update, decided to buy Kevo Plus
text:
Kevo and I have had a love hate relationship. The lock is invaluable when it works but infuriating when it doesn't. 

Now, I feel like we have finally made our peace. The bugs have minimized, I learned how to actually change the batteries on time (get rechargeable batteries, and rotate them...saves money) and most importantly the features promised have been delivered. 

Instead of pulling the bull@&$? other companies try, they don't try and make you buy a $200 Kevo 2.0. They deliver a remote unlocking feature for all users with this update PLUS offer an add on for $70 that enables complete remote operation. Personally, I think it's a great deal and any regret I had about going Kevo (instead of something like an August lock) has gone out the remotely opened door.

title: Newest software update is TERRIBLE
text: I learned to live with the fact that they charge you for additional permanent ekeys even though that is ridiculous. I lived with the fact that it sometimes takes 3-4 attempts of opening and closing the app to open the lock (even though it's supposed to open without the app being open and just having Bluetooth on). But now after I updated the app and the lock software, I find myself standing outside the door for 5 minutes at a time and I was locked out completely once. If your device that you sell is a Bluetooth door lock, make sure it at least OPENS THE DOOR! I find myself contemplating one of the many other options to keyless door locks that actually work and have the "remote unlock" from anywhere feature built in, not another add on you have to buy after they finally catch up to the competition's technology. Feeling very underwhelmed by this device to say the least.

title: Buyer Beware
text:
I’ve had three Kevo locks for about four years now. They just keep getting worse. I don’t even use the touch feature anymore. I also have Kevo Plus, which seems to be blocked lately. It shows up for a sec when I reboot app and then it’s gone. I’ve spoken with technical support and their answer seems to be uninstall and reinstall app. Doesn’t work. Luckily it’s still a quickset lock. I’m back to a key. I bought this lock because I loved the idea of a convenient smart lock integrated with a well known deadbolt manufacturer. Problem with that is Kwikset isn’t a technology company.

Update: Recent update has fixed everything. Lock opens first time every time. Very happy. Thanks.

title: I love mine
text:
This app works with any Kevo lock.  Sort of strange to review this as an app, b/c I only use the app for admin purposes, like sending eKeys or disabling eKeys. This has been really handy last two weekends when guests arrived and we weren't home.  setting up notifications is nice, but if I really want to know lock activity, it's all in a log.  Was pretty impressive to know that my househuests acccepted their eKey and when they arrived at my house unlocking the door. I guess notifications will also be cool when the battery is low.   
In the end, this app runs in background, and I touch my front door lock to gain entry or lock house.   Stupendously awesome for our family.   Lifestyle changer.  Been waiting years for this.

title: Sotware issues
text:
This app feature has gotten worse with every update. Takes me forever to lock the door as well as unlock it. I have to get into my phone and open the app every time because it automatically closes after every use. I hope my life never depends on getting in. The app it takes forever now to find the lock.... stressful at night when I want to get into the house quickly and not linger in the dark. 
The last time I tried to get in it complained that there was no location capability.
I've switched back to keys.

------ some months previously:
Recently tried to get in. I've started asking me numerous questions including if I want to change location settings etc., before it would let me in. The next day when I tried to leave and lock the door, the app acted as if it was new on my phone and wanted to start installation. I had to log in, upon which it asked me to set up keys and said no keys were pre-existing :/ A few minutes the old settings showed up again. Additionally, when I leave, most of the time I have to re-start the app even though I never had closed it. And when I come home, it is common that I need to try the activation a few times, touching the lock. It is a good lock, but because of the app issues I find myself often using the physical key. Faster and easier.

title: Functions Fine, Battery Hog After Latest Update!
text: Have been using this app for over a year, with no real problems beyond the initial iOS 10 hiccup, but this most recent update which promised more accurate and better response times is now an absolute battery drain!  Used to hover around 5% of my battery usage, noticed the last couple days I have had to recharge multiple times per day, lo and behold Kevo is now reported to use 20-25% of my battery...  What?!?!  To lock/unlock a door a couple times per day?  This is unacceptable.  I have updated settings in the app to enable low power mode, but I really do not think this should be necessary.  I would like the faster response times without the app taking more battery power than any other app on my phone, including Mail with push and frequent fetch enabled.  Hope this gets addressed in another update soon.

title: Works Flawlessly
text:
Bought Kevo for the office when it first came out.  Fantastic product. Worked so well I bought 2 for my house. Again, worked fantastic.  Flawless product.  When Kevo introduced Kevo Plus I bought it for the office and it's been great.  Remote access is great and works just as it is advertised.  Liked Kevo Plus so well I bought one for my house and it's been fantastic.  Saved a call to a locksmith twice.  

Checked in with Kevo support twice and they were helpful. Solved a question I had on key ownership question for Kevo Plus.  Doesn't get any better.  

Great product.  Works exactly as advertised (Kevo and Kevo Plus gateway).  Have been a customer since Kevo was introduced.  Highly recommend.

title: Product was fantastic then they changed the software
text: When I first purchased the product and installed it I was absolutely delighted with the functionality and ease-of-use. Recently they changed the software which is completely unstable and requires you to constantly have to login. The system was set up for my family members and all of us were able to access the software with ease. The new version of software constantly logs out and has to have The password typed in and then initiate. This new software modification makes it harder to use than simply using a key. If the software is it corrected very soon I am uninstalling and going back to a standard luck.

title: Kēvo 1st Gen with Plus upgrade
text:
We have had the 1st Generation about a year now. Upgraded to Kēvo Plus a couple of months ago. If I was just rating the basic lock I would have given it 3 stars, but the Plus is a significant upgrade. I like the app and do not have the problems others are reporting. The lock itself is finicky, works by touch for me usually on the first time but with my wife's phone three or four tries to open by touch.

We upgraded to the Kēvo Plus because of my son, who is currently in college and living at home. It's nice to be able to lock the door behind him and check the status. I wish it worked with our smart home hub so I could setup alerts and such.

title: Can I give it zero?
text:
Like so many others we bought the Kevo thinking it would make life easier for us. Wrong! It's been nothing but a pain since we bought it over a year ago. Also got the Kevo Plus Gateway which was even more glitchy than the door lock. First off there are no instructions for pairing the gateway with the door. The instructions say to configure it using instructions in the app but there are none. 

I finally did get it paired with help from tech-support. Mine is about 20-25 feet away from the door and it routinely cannot "find" the door lock. Called Kwikset back and got nowhere with their support. They open a trouble ticket to investigate my problem. They wore me down so much I gave up until about 8 months later. My trouble ticklet was there but NOTHING had been done with it in the entire 8 month stretch. 

Finally got them to send me a replacement gateway. It's the same model, same manufacturer, and it does not look like it's been upgraded at all so I don't have a lot of optimism that it will behave any different. The jury is out because, again, they have not updated their instructions or the app help so I have no instructions for pairing it with the gateway and I am on hold waiting for tech-support to walk me through it again. 

Do yourself a favor and buy something else.

title: Unreliable for primary function
text:
While the user interface of this app is pretty straight forward, It has proven to be totally unreliable for the primary function I got a smart lock for, to be able to unlock the door without the key or when someone was at the door without having to walk up. The bluetooth functionality of the app is completely unreliable and requires a complete power cycle of my iPhone for it to start working again. I have an iPhone 7 and my wife has a X we both have had the same issue where it is no longer able to find my lock even when we are standing inches away from it until completely power off and restart the phones. 

Also if you give it the location services and other background operation privileges it request it will run down you phone in just a few hours making that whole feature basically unusable.

title: A large step in the right direction
text: Out of the smart locks this beats the August and others hands down.  I do wish there were more IFTTT triggers but I'm glad they're getting on board!  It's not perfect but it does connect with the Nest for Away mode (which you can set an IFTTT trigger for when you leave a proximity - phone based location - your Nest goes into away mode) and give you peace of mind.  I do recommend the gateway as an additional piece of mind.  In combo with other smart devices we have (Nest, garagio, Nest Protect, Hue White, Ring, Rachio & a DIY security system) we have a strong automation sweet with the addition of the Kevo together that can be combined with Alexa & IFTTT for some really epic smart home features that bring us into the future we've been talking about for a while.

title: HORRIBLE!!!
text: Both the lock and the app are horrible. I used my phone to do the initial setup. It worked spotty right off the bat, and it has now gotten to the point that I will be holding my phone directly in front of the lock and it won't pick it up at all. Even with multiple attempts by touching the lock and trying to unlock with the app. It doesn't matter whether I have my Bluetooth on and/or app open or closed; in any combination. On the flip-side, it picks up my husband's phone from the driveway, he just has to have his Bluetooth on. BUT it has a mind of its own and will lock and unlock the door when he passes by. Needless to say, this app has rendered itself totally useless for both of us. I am extremely disappointed. We always do our research and read reviews prior to making such an important and expensive purchase, and for some reason we decided to chance it on the decent reviews. Total regret.

title: Great "idea"
text: I like the "idea" of this lock much more than I actually like the lock itself. I constantly have issues unlocking the door with the app and the FOBs that I have purchased. Not sure why it is so hard to get consistent quality with this product. Stupidest thing though, you can't "register" the FOBs. So I can't see when someone accessing my home with a FOB. that's just insanity. Not to mention that Kevo has been out for 2 years and hasn't pushed for wink to add it as an approved device? When I pay this price for a product, I expect quality. I know you're mainly a lock company, but now that you've been tapping into the tech industry, it's time to invest in a few more software developers. I hope that Kwikset works the kinks out soon, otherwise, my next lock sadly, will not be another Kevo.

title: Kēvo oh no!
text: The kēvo system has the opportunity to be a quality of life genius, but falls short in many ways.  The very first mistake is not defining for customers how to program left and right swing openings.  Even the displays at area home improvement stores are done incorrectly.  The next flaw is lack of information regarding the bridge.  The unit sometimes works and often not without the bridge.  Lastly, the plastic parts are horrible and any Savy thief can bump lock open the unit.  Save your money it is a gimmick that will frustrate you.  Note* I owned a hardware store for nearly 20 years and installed builders hardware for 6 years in high rises commercial buildings.  It’s brilliant and squarely falls short in execution.

title: Feeling ripped off
text: So I was so pumped for this lock, decided to pay $240 bucks for this great lock and app that would allow me to just touch the dead bolt to unlock the door. My girlfriend and I even nicknamed it "the boop" because we could just boop it and be in the house. Well, after having it for 10 days, it only works 10% of the time. And that is when I have my phone out and have to push the app to unlock the door. Now, the "experts" at the lock company have told me to uninstall my app, turn off my phone and, turn it back on and then reinstall the app to fix the problems. I have an Iphone7Plus, running IOS 10.3 and the app will not reinstall on my phone! So now this lock that cost 3 times what a normal deadbolt would, is now just a normal deadbolt. What a waste of money. Was so excited to have this and give it 5 stars now If I could give this product and experience zero stars I would.

title: Love it
text: Works great, if you will take the time to read and understand it. I look down through the reviews and see most low rating are due to people not taking responsibility for there own actions and understanding the numerous ways to correctly use the lock, app, and hierarchy capabilities. If don't care to understand the product but just want unrestricted open access to your home then you should save your money and leave your doors unlocked. If you want a great quality traditional lock that happens to have bluetooth access convenience, multiple use variations, a user timestamp, and restricted hours of use capability then this is a great lock!!

title: Edited review
text:
Edit: just got iPhone 8 and the app now allows my husband and I to both be logged in at the same time and it doesn’t make us continually enter our password like it did before. Huge improvement!

Original:  I just updated my Kēvo app and now I have to sign in every time I use it. That means I'm standing by my door, putting my password into my phone while juggling whatever I'm carrying. What a pain! If there was an emergency, that would cause a huge delay. I liked it so much better when it kept me signed in or why not make it recognize my thumbprint if you want it to be more secure.  Having to type in my password for every use is not practical and I'm ready to get rid of it and go back to a regular key.

title: Could be great!
text:
This review is more of the product as a whole than the app.  I've been using it for a few months now and here are my thoughts.  When it works it's the greatest thing ever!  There's nothing like walking up to your door and touching it and it unlocking.  It's great.  However sometimes I have to touch the lock multiple times for it to connect, or even worse I have to take my phone out of my pocket and hold it next to the door.  Also I've inadvertently touched the lock while walking outside without the phone in my pocket yet the lock has still locked!  Luckily this hasn't caused me to get locked out yet.  

All in all a solid 4-star product and hopefully continued software updates move up to 5-stars.

title: Bought First Generation & Feel Cheated
text:
I bought the first generation of the Kevo/Kwikset venture back in 2014 for 4x what a normal lock cost and have had tons of issues with it - all for the worse. Too many glitches to be reliable enough to not have to bring my key - which pretty much defeats the whole purpose of it. Been on the phone with their support team for hours over the years and always ends up having the same issue of it getting disconnected and needing to be re-set.

To top all of that off, I felt cheated once again when they started trying to nickel and dime you for extra digital keys (eventually gave you more for free) but the corporate greed intent was undeniable.

I still feel betrayed because, as an early adopter, my purchase helped get this product off the ground. They’ve treated me like a Guinea Pig because they didn’t have all the bugs resolved before I got the lock.

title: Kēvo Has Come A Long Way
text: I've had a Kēvo lock since its early release. First used the fob, then an LG G4, now an iPhone 7 plus. I have two 1st gen Kēvos and the Bluetooth gateway. This app works very well 95% of the time. Every so often a second tap is needed but that is usually due to some odd placement of my phone. Remote locking and unlocking has never failed. I only have two gripes. First Kwikset really needs to make this HomeKit compatible. Second for us  gateway owners, where are the additional features?  Scheduled lock times would be nice. Also a geofence notice so if I'm away from home and a lock is unlocked, I receive a notification. Come on Kwikset make it happen.

title: Just don't.
text: Do you crave the idea of a lock that responds well when you're empty handed and can hold the phone directly to the lock, but cannot function if your phone is 12 inches away in your pocket and your hands full of groceries?   Do you love the idea of always having a spare key handy, knowing that Kēvo will fail soon enough?  Do you adore having to delete the Kevo app and the reinstalling with each iOS update so that touching the lock will "kindof" work, and making your friends all do the same?  Do you love having the kevo app ask you weekly if you "love" kevo, and having to click "no" because you hate it with every fiber of you're being?   Do you love being trapped in a nonsense lock, with its Wi-Fi extender because it was so crappy in the first place, and now not being able to get out because the equipment is all so expensive?   Then do I have the lock for YOU!   Get Kevo!

title: Not sure if the door is locked
text:
I don’t just have the Kēvo I splurged and got the Kēvo plus. Now with the iOS 11 upgrade my lock might as well be a paper weight. For the last few days I haven’t been able to lock or unlock my door by touch. I have to use the remote system and even then it takes about 3 attempts before the door is locked or unlocked. I paid entirely to much for this equipment to have to be this unsure of the security of my home. 

There is some much to say from the key fob that doesn't work to the fact that the activity log and current status hardly ever match. I have had the current status show the door locked after I had opened it and was stand at the door. And yes I stand there tapping the lock so long I might as well just used the key. It is a great help when my family comes by because I work out of town but the app does not help my feel secure.

title: Always has issues!!
text:
I've always had issues with this app! They claim at one point that you didn't need the app to be opened to be able to use your Kēvo. Bull....! I've always had to have my phone out, with the Bluetooth, and the app opened right in front of the lock!! And ever since apple sent out their last software update, I haven't been able to use the app nor the lock with their key (that comes with the kit) at all!!! Have to use the old fashion keys to lock my house. The app says "The deadbolt has jammed. Check your door for alignment and make sure the latch bolt can operate smoothly". EVERY TIME!! Mind you, there's NOTHING wrong with my door or the deadbolt!!! 

I think I have to call and write to the company and their corporate office, in the next few days. (Will wait for thanksgiving to be over with.) 

My advice....don't bother!!

title: Huge waste of money
text:
This saves zero time compared to unlocking a door with keys. It takes forever to connect to wifi and then longer still to unlock the door, plus the 5 failed attempts before that - it takes
a good 2 minutes to unlock compared to the 30 seconds a key takes. This has NEVER worked from a pocket or bag, it's the opposite to hands free and it has a bonus of randomly locking as you're walking through the door. So then you have to manually unlock it, before you can spend another 10 minutes locking it again. The absolute worse thing we purchased when gut renovating our home. Hate it, hate it, hate it so much, I leave my door unlocked if I'm just going out for a few minutes to walk the dog. I'm at the stage where I want to remove the batteries and go back to using the key. If you're on the fence about purchasing this - DON'T!!!!

title: Great product; finicky installation
text: Our son has a Kevo on his house and set us up with ekeys on our iPhones. We were so impressed we had to get one. Ours is in the garage (didn't fit on our front door), which works out great because there's no more struggling to fish out keys when coming in with groceries or back from a run (our cars are keyless too). The first install was tricky (don't over tighten the screws or it won't work!) and we couldn't activate the finger-touch. The app only worked if you pulled out your phone to do the unlock. Kevo customer service said it was a malfunction, so they swapped it for a new one. The second time it was much easier to install and activation was a breeze. Love the convenience of it!

title: Hate hate hate Kēvo!
text: There is nothing worse than tapping the Kēvo door knob SEVERAL TIMES waiting for the lock to open! I would stand NEXT to the lock with the Kēvo app open tapping the door knob. No response. Also, I left my iPhone on the breakfast table, opened the patio door to let my dogs out, went outside and the door shut. The Kēvo LOCKED me out of the house!! It is a POS! Our previous lock had the numeric keypad which is SO MUCH BETTER! What was considered to be a "convenience" is now an expensive nuisance. So now when I leave the house, I open the garage door and just walk out. (Our cars are parked in the Porte cochere and our jet skis and trailer are in the garage.)

title: Needs autolock
text:
This is the first and only smart lock I’ve had. It works most of the time, but the touch to unlock has failed a multiple times, forcing me to pull my phone out and use the app to unlock it. 

Also, what would make this lock so much better is if it would auto lock at a programmable time or after a certain period of time in case you forget to lock it. Or an alert that tells you the door is unlocked.

Since the update, the lock has worked even worse than before. It locks/unlocks by touch less than half of the time now. I don’t even bother touching it anymore, I just pull out my phone and use the app to unlock. Just today, I was on the other side of the house and my kids were touching the lock and unlocked the door while I wasn’t even near it. I regret spending the extra money on this lock.

title: Found a workaround without upgrading
text: When My husband bought this in February I was disappointed that it did not work with my phone, as I had iOS8, and didn't want to upgrade. It came with a fob, which is what I used instead except it only worked half the time. After several calls to customer support (when they were open) they sent me a new fob. But every person I talked to seemed confused to learn that the app did not work with my phone's iOS. Apparently they weren't aware of the update that rolled out the month earlier. Anyway, turns out, if you download the app onto a device that can handle it, you can then download the last known version that works with the iOS. Tested, and works, whichever version I ended up with.

title: I'd rate higher but their customer support is lacking.
text:
Had my kēvo for quite some time now and was loving it. Then one day I bought the kēvo plus and loved it more. Then they came out with an update. It crashed the kēvo plus and after many, MANY emails with customer support I returned my kēvo plus. 
Word to the wise, once you have kēvo plus it makes the regular Bluetooth feature worse!!!!  
Anyway- after almost two weeks since I returned the kēvo plus they still hadn't contacted me. I finally called them and after a very LONG phone call they admitted to losing my information and never processing the receipt of my defective kēvo plus. The did rush me out a replacement, and since my kēvo has been running very well again.

title: It's a great idea....
text:
We got A Kevo lock because our son kept losing his keys, but he always knows where his cell phone is.  

I love Kevo because it really is easy.  As long as your phone is charged, no problem getting in your house quickly and easily.  

However, what I hate about it is that sometimes I am just walking outside, with or without my phone and the door will lock - I'm not touching the lock at all and I didn't touch my phone or even go to the app.  Like I said, this also happens without my phone - so I have locked myself out - with no way to get back in.  If that gets taken care of, I will love it, but until then, I will continue to have a love hate relationship with Kevo.  I want it to lock only when I lock it!

title: Works well, could use some improvements
text:
Installing was easy as was setting up virtual keys for everyone in my family. Does occasionally fail to open/lock door on first attempt thru Bluetooth. Also bought a Kēvo Plus gateway for remote control and that too was easily installed and works as expected. From a hardware perspective, it looks nice and appears to be as strong as any other residential deadbolt. Really like the Kwikset Smartkey feature; was able to rekey our entire house - both smart locks and traditional - to use a single master key. 

Things I would like to see added:
- notifications when door left unlocked for some amount of time
- HomeKit compatibility

title: The new update read "bug fixes" ....
text:
... but sadly the lock is still there :)

I really like this lock when I first purchased it.  A little love hate, but mostly love.  It had some issues, but mostly it seemed to work well about 90% of the time.

Then it went to about to about 50/50.

Lately it has been more trouble than joy and new updates don't seem to improve the basically functionality, they only seem to add more features that don't work well.

It used to be that you could have the app closed and the lock would generally function at a normal distance.  Now, even with the app open I have to basically put the hip with the phone in the pocket against the door and it still often won't open.  Half the time I am standing outside with my phone in my hand, maybe an inch from the door and it won't open.  The light circles round and round the lock and the door just won't unlock when you touch it.

Pull up the app and it says connecting and shows orange for locked, but when you press the lock it does a circle and the reconnects.

It has become a disaster, where it is now far easier to just pull out a key and unlock it.  It defeats the very purpose for replacing my old lock.

title: Currently not compatible with iOS 9.1
text: Today I received my kevo gateway. I have had the cable lock and been pleased with it for over a year now. I was hoping to install the gate way today so I could control the lock from my phone. I was unable to connect the gateway and the lock. I am running the latest version of the Kevo lock software but the gateway pairing process insists that the lock needs more updates. After verifying that my luck was indeed running the latest version I contacted Kevo support. A chat representative named Wendy said that they were aware of the issue with iOS 9.1 and that they hope to have a fix out soon but that currently the gateway pairing is incompatible with the latest iPhone operating system.

title: Kills your phone battery life
text: Just got the lock installed 2 days ago, using just like instructions say with app running in background. I have several other apps that run in the background and most they use is 4-5% battery over 24 hours, this app used a whopping 28% of my battery life over past 24hrs more than even the screen on my phone uses which is ridiculous, there needs to be some serious work done in relation to this on the app, what’s the point of having it if it drains your battery so fast during the day you can’t use it because your phone is dead before you get home. This would be a 5 star product as I have had no issues whatsoever but the serious battery drain gives me pause to recommend it to anyone

title: great but has its quirks
text: kevo is a great, easy way to unlock a door without the hassle of keeping a key. you can always get in to your house and don't always have to keep track of a house key. the only problems I have received with the app is that when I first downloaded the app it would shut down every time I would try to open it, which eventually made me have to delete the app I redownload it. after redownloading the app, I received no other difficulty except occasionally not having the door unlock the first try, making me have to press it again. other than that, the app is great and extremely easy!

title: Not worth the hassle
text:
Today I removed my Kevo lock from my door and will be deleting the app as well. The simple reality is that the convenience of Kevo is significantly outweighed by the hassle. After 6 months or so we started suffering repeat lock and unlocks, where the door would randomly lock and unlock itself several times in a row. This, coupled with slow unlock times, random app logouts, a very loud locking mechanism, and really obnoxious notifications (you can either get a push notification and an email or nothing) led me and my wife to change out our kevo for a much simpler, more reliable, cheaper keypad dead bolt. 

Kwikset is refunding our purchase after enough complaining, thankfully. 

Give this tech a few more years to develop. In the meantime, it's more hassle than help.

title: I'm tired of signing in just to unlock my door
text: I should have waited for the reviews before purchasing. Kevo is so slooow to recognize your phone.  It's loud when it opens the door and most annoyingly it signs you out whenever you restart your phone or the app auto updates. What a pain to stand outside your door and have to fish for your phone, open the app and type in your user name and password. Isn't that much more difficult than getting your key out?  I find I need to do this a few times a week. If anyone from kwikset is reading this, I don't want to have to sign into your app. I'm sure you see this as a security measure, but it's not one I'm interested in. Please get rid of the sign in before using or at least make it optional. Please also allow a way to open a door remotely, it's one of the reasons I purchased this lock.

title: Not Good for Airbnb
text: I host an Airbnb. Thought this would be a great feature but it’s actually caused more issues for me than help me. My owner eKey works GREAT! BUT I have had EVERY renter and my housekeeper contact me with access issues. This is frustrating. If I give administrative access to an anytime key it works great- but I’m not giving admin access to a person I don’t know. Also, there are older renters who are totally frustrated with technology to start with. Helping them troubleshoot an app while they stand on my front porch is both asinine and infuriating. This was a waste of my money. Kwikset offers no information regarding guest access keys and I can’t even get ahold of anyone who seems to know what I am talking about. If there is a fix for this, I will adjust my review but until then I will do everything I can to make sure it gets returned.

title: Connectivity Issues
text:
I’ve spent a great deal of time reading all the reviews and this Kwikset/Kēvo is always rated towards the top of the list.  I’m running iOS 11.1, and I’m having repetitive issues with the app where it will continually search for the lock and never locate anything.   I’ve force closed over and over, hoping it would pick up the lock. It is only at the point of me rebooting my iPhone 7 completely, that it picks it right up immediately.  This is every day, twice a day... I’m now training myself to reboot my phone 5 minutes prior to leaving or coming home.  Not exactly convenient.

This happened with another product in the past and suddenly with an app update the connectivity issues were no longer.

Can you do that?

title: Completely ruined a functioning product
text: Our Kēvo lock used to be OK, perhaps a little too laggy in registering a touch and opening. Somewhere along the way Kēvo decided to "improve" the app and now it is even slower and is such a battery hog that my wife and I both have to force quit the app to preserve phone battery. This makes the Kēvo even worse as you have to take your phone out and launch the app, wait for it to detect the lock, then fail to open, then finally it will open and then we have to force quit the app to stop it from sucking the phone dry. Avoid this product. Look at all the reviews complaining about battery usage and heed the warning. Kēvo has known about these battery problems for at least 2 months and no updates. Lazy. Crap product. Just get a regular lock and save yourself the frustration.

title: Waste of money. Lots of money!
text: Beware!  This system is terrible. All the other reviewers were right. We have had this lock installed for the past 2 months. It has been extremely unreliable. All members of my family have trouble getting the lock to either lock or unlock. It takes 6 or 7 tries to lock or unlock the door each time. It only seems to work if you close your app then re open the app. But even that does not work all the time. Even using a fob does not work all the time. Meanwhile you are stuck holding the groceries out in the rain. Just waiting to get locked out of the house while being chased by a rabid dog or killer clown. All kidding aside, this lock consistently does not work. You are guaranteed to be frustrated. I can only hope that the lock will work when I need it most.

title: Gen 1 locks barely work with Bluetooth
text: I so wanted this lock to work well. I bought two of the Gen 1 locks only months before the Gen 2 locks were announced. I liked the ability to be able to lock and unlock from anywhere should I need to so I even bought the Wi-Fi bridge. They’ve been nothing but crap for me. The locks never seem to connect to my iPhone via Bluetooth. I always have to open the app to tap the unlock button on the screen. The tap to open feature of the locks never works... unless you don’t want it to work. Then somehow when you walk outside to grab the paper and happen to touch the lock housing, it locks.
