I just don’t get it. I would love to know if these problems are fixed in Gen 2, but I don’t want to throw away another few hundred bucks. Kwickset, please fix this!!!

title: No stars!
text: The worst thing I've ever bought, worst thing I've ever bought and I'm sorry I've actually thrown my money, but I'm even more sorry to have bought kevo plus too which has made it even more complicated to use.  This called  "smart" lock if you just bought it, it's imperative that you always carry the actual door key in Your pocket, you never know when it will fail, but be sure that it will fail, touch to open only works with the iphone in your hand and the application opened, sometimes I'm at my door looking at the lights and NOTHING HAPPENS very frustrating I could write a lot more about this but I think the message is clear, If you are investing in a lock do not do it in Kevo simply it doesn't work as the manufacturer promises it will, neither the lock nor the application nor kevo plus.

title: Horrible connectivity
text: Have had this unit for 3 years and I don't know why I still have it. Too lazy to replace it I guess. I don't even use my front door anymore I just go through my garage door. When using Kevo not only do I have to pull my phone out of my back pocket (It will not reconginize my phone from that far), I have to hold my phone no more than 12" from the lock itself. And further more  70% of the time it will not work the first time, so you are now sitting there waiting for it to cycle once then try again. It takes an average of 30 seconds to get in my front door. Count out 30 seconds! It's a long time to sit and wait to get in your front door. I love the idea and the technology and hope they come out with a better model soon.

title: Solid smart lock
text: First off, I'm giving this a four because there's always room for improvement. But it's as simple as this: Kevo, if installed and calibrated correctly, is just as secure if not more secure than any deadbolt out there. It is also incredibly easy for an owner or permitted user to operate, which is why it's a a smart lock. Notably, from the front, it appears to be a standard deadbolt and doesn't look like a robot attached to your door, begging for attention from unscrupulous clods. Finally, it functions exactly like advertised. Looking forward to the ability to lock or unlock remotely by phone later this year. All in all, this lock is great.

title: Great potential, poor software choices
text:
I bought this product to add to my smarthome with nest, wink, Zwave and other products only to find out the integration with nest is weak at best and it doesn't play nice with wink like the previous versions of kevo. Very disappointed!! To add to the disappointment I found out after spending $200 and a Saturday morning installing it that I can only activate 2 ekeys before having to pay $2 for each additional one. Seriously?! Isn't that one of the advantages of smart locks? Not having to deal with keys and that bs. I hope they fix some of these major misses with a software update because this truly has some good potential but was cut short with crappy software choices. This is the first app review I've ever wrote if that tell you how frustrated it made me...
Please fix the software!!!!

title: Great smart lock
text: Read online reviews, looked at units in store and finally decided that this was the best for the price and features. The Schlage requires a specific hub (for remote use) and I currently use an Insteon hub, so no need for another one. The August was HUGE on the inside of the door and just plain ugly. Also had a lot of bad reviews for being slow with a weak motor. The Kevo looked great, was easy to install and get going the app is smooth and easy. The Kevo plus remote feature is a simple upgrade through Kwikset and is a dedicated device that connects to your router. Thumbs up and great pick.

title: UPDATE: Offline for a week
text:
Well their website was throwing permission errors when logging in and appeared their hosting was down the first week of June. With all the issues, I would avoid this brand. Go with a Z-Wave compatible brand that is likely to be supported by more than one vendor.

Basically works... But it's hit and miss. Sometimes you have to stand outside your door too long waiting for it to unlock. Getting the Plus gateway helps a lot but it jacks the price up another $100... for a feature and reliability that it should've had in the first place. Oh, and a week after I paid for unlimited keys, they make them free. Another waste of money. 

Suggestion for the developer... if you only have one lock, the app should default to the lock control screen rather than the list of locks.

title: Completely unreliable
text: Bought a house a couple years ago that had a Kēvo lock. It used to work fine but has become more unreliable with each update. Initially I could shut the app down and it still worked. Then I had to keep the app running in the background. I'm fine with that. Now I'm forced to restart the app every couple of days or sit and watch the stupid light circle the ring forever. If I'm going to take my phone out to restart the app, I might as well just take out my keys.  Sometimes I'll be standing at my door, phone in hand, and the app says it's still searching for he lock to give me a status, yet it's able to unlock the door. I would NEVER consider leaving my house without a backup way to get in, and if I have to do that then it defeats the whole purpose.

title: More Control over Guest Ekeys Needed
text:
I’ve been using a Kevo 2nd Gen as I recently started hosting my home as a BnB while out of town. It performs okay but the problem is how the scheduling of ekeys works.

It’s impossible to start a scheduled key at a time on one day and continue access until a set time on a different day (e.g. 3pm Mon thru 12pm Fri). I have to send a anytime key and manually remember to activate and delete at the appropriate times. This seems like it would be an easy fix for the developers to add the options. 

I also purchased the additional gateway for reliability in case a guest had issues getting in so that i could do it manually from anywhere. The Gateway works great although it has to be purchased separately. 

Another issue I’ve noticed is in the History. It will show when the door is unlocked by a guest but not when locked.

Hopefully future updates can correct these issues. Besides that, i do like the appearance and remote monitoring of my door lock status.

title: Rarely works
text: I have the first gen Kēvo deadbolt. This app has never really worked in conjunction with that lock.  Failed attempts to unlock the door via Bluetooth while standing in the rain. That moment when you forget your keys. Even sending a temporary key to a friend is difficult because you have to do it via email and it’s not a very mobile friendly process. I give this one star because it does try to do what is advertised, but ultimately this product is a failure at its current stage. I would have liked to buy a newer version of the kevo lock. But my local big box stores only sell the first gen and tricked me into thinking it was the most recent one at the time of purchase. Kwikset needs to focus a lot more on customer experience. Not sure I will give them another chance.

title: Much better
text:
The previous version of the software and lock firmware were disappointing, so much so that I actually pulled the Kevo lock and stuck it in a drawer.
I was just prompted a new version of the software was available, and that included a new version of the lock firmware, so I gave the lock another try.
This is a HUGE improvement. Reliability has been 100% so far, lock and unlock times are now virtually instantaneous. 

To the reviewer that claims he can’t set it up when connected via WiFi - I suspect its a firewall problem. I had no such problems, at all.

title: Kēvo System
text: I built a new house and added Kevo lock technology.  It worked fine if I was right up on it with my phone in my hand, however, sometimes I had to sit there with it for a minute to get in.  I have three locks on the system. I called Kevo customer service and they recommended the Kevo Plus Hub.  They said I would then be able to unlock the doors remotely if someone we locked out while I was at work.  I bought that.  The installation was easy, lights are all on, but I cannot get that to work.  All in all, a key would be quicker and much less hassle.

title: Generally good
text: I like the convenience of the app and easily sending keys to guests and friends. It worked quite well when I purchased the lock in 2016 but a few months ago after updating the software it became less user friendly and sometimes ridiculously slow to load. I'd have to stand and wait outside the door a full minute or more waiting for it. It also kills battery fast on an iPhone if you leave it running in the background. Lastly for iPhone 4S users it's hard to send keys since last update because the "send" button is mostly out of sight at the bottom of the screen and you cannot scroll down to access it.

title: Last update ruin my lock
text: I have a first generation Kevo lock, which has been working great, that is until the Feb. 9th update. Ever since the update my lock barely works. 8 times out of 10 I have to use my actual key because the app does not work. When the app does work I have to get my phone out and open the app, rather than have it open in the background. I have sent a message to Kēvo with no reply. Either fix this or I want my money back, because $250 is way too much to spend on a lock that no longer works the way it was intended, especially seeing as it did work before the 2/9/17 update.

title: I Love Technology
text:
I preordered the locks and couldn't wait for them to arrive. They were easy to install as long as you made sure the antenna wire was not compromised. I accidentally cut one but customer service was great about getting me a new lock.
I agree about the software and firmware updates. I was pretty angry when it almost made my locks unusable. It was reported that it was a performance improvement so I was looking forward to it. I found that even after the firmware update I needed to close and restart the app on my phone for it to start working correctly.

title: Kevo Plus
text: I gave Kevo four stars because I’ve had the app fail numerous times when I’m at work which makes it unable for me to check to see if my door is locked. I paid extra for Kevo Plus, so it should work anywhere. I should be able to go on my app anywhere in the world and be able to access my Kevo at home and I can’t always do that because the app malfunctions. I also gave it four stars because often times my deadbolt will unlock or lock itself without the app being open or running. It could make it easy for me to lock myself out of the house or have an intruder come in.

title: No more standing in the rain & you have key upgrade but do not realize it !!!
text:
Edit: this is the last try I’ve given all to make this thing work but maybe the service is better in Atlanta and if that’s the case I’ll have to switch out locks and use bolt locks deny access. Standing in the rain with no form of direction on what steps to take to get this thing to work is making life stagnant. Please help. 

I bought into this app to keep my loved ones from standing and waiting outside in the rain because they don’t have a key. Question: is it possible that my loved one can give me a key to his place as well. It’s hard waiting on an answer while trying to hold on to my umbrella if I’m stuck waiting outside his door.

title: Not dependable
text: I have had the kevo for over a year it is definitely a hit or miss product.  One thing that does help is that you need to turn your Wi-Fi off otherwise when you get to your front door or the phone is too busy trying to connect to Wi-Fi it can't handle Bluetooth at the same time.  I have an iPhone 6, and I work for Verizon.  It's also kind of goofy when you want to leave the door open it will lock randomly.  I can count half a dozen times where I had to go to the garage because the lock would not sync correctly.  Cool technology just not perfect like any technology.  I give it three stars great when it works very frustrating when it doesn't.

title: Works much better now
text:
Aside from the fact that I don't understand why they released this update mentioning a firmware update for the lock that has yet to be released, the latest update is very good.

One of the problems with this lock is that it took so much time to open. The latest update effectively cuts that time and half; we are able to open the lock in a short as two seconds now which is huge. 

Unlike other reviewers, I don't have to keep the app in the foreground, as long as it's been one once after you rebooted or reset the phone you're fine. 

I do wish this product remotely unlocked the door. It's a Bluetooth lock, not a Wi-Fi walk, so it does that limited functionality. 

Other than that though, it's great for when you have your hands full and just want the door opened. The latest update finally has the lock approaching the speed of a normal key. Recommended.

title: Need notification when updates are made
text: This is a great app when it works. Today I got home from work (encumbered with all kinds of stuff)and it would not open my door. I dredged out my phone and opened the app and was greeted with a login page. What? I used the physical key to get in, set down all of my stuff and looked up the password so I could log in. Apparently Kēvo had updated the app. Why I had to log in again, I do not know. My suggestion is for Kēvo to text when there is an update that will require a login. Or not require a login.

title: Awesome!
text: So far I can't complain. I've had the lock for about a month and love it. It was easy to install (well my friend did it for me and said it was lol), and works like a charm. Occasionally it will lock on me as I'm walking out the door but so far I haven't been locked out without my phone. I've tested the theory a few times to make sure. I'm going to try and calibrate the Kevo to see if it will work better when my phone is in my purse. So far I have to keep it in my in my hand or in my uniform shirt pocket. Non of which bothers me tho. Definitely worth all 5 stars!!!

title: Used to love this lock
text: It’s been a sketchy ride since iOS10.  The first couple years I would brag about the lock and even encourage others to get it.  At this point though, if I do t use the app for a day, it locks while running in the background.  I have to pull out my phone and open the app for the lock to recognize.  Reinstalling the app sometimes fixes it for a day or two, but that’s no solution.  I do have a gen1 lock, so maybe it’s just run its course.  I have no intentions to buy a newer one since part of it is the app.  Also, the complete lack of supposed for HomeKit, after this long, I’ll be picking up one that supports the ecosystem I know and love.  Just can’t keep making excuses for this lock or the app anymore.

title: Issues since last update
text:
When Kēvo works it is a great lock but since the last update I have been having two issues.

First whenever I open the app it asks if it can send me push notifications, I say no, it warns me, I say no then the next time I open the app even 30 seconds later it asks if it can send push notifications, every single time.

Why am I opening the ap so much? Since the most recent update kevo has decided to not work even if open in the background unless I open the ap. When I open the ap it works every time but this defeats the Tim saving of kevo. Prior to the update kevo worked flawlessly in the background. Please fix the ap.

title: Not Reliable!!
text:
The issue(s)
I have with the Kevo lock is that it will intermittently unlock itself after you've locked it and have driven/walked away.  Very scary to come home later and find the door unlocked!! I have observed that for some reason after a period of several minutes it'll unlock itself Really defeats the purpose  of having a secure locking mechanism.  Very frustrating! 
And another issue I have experienced is that it'll re-lock itself after being unlocked manually from the inside and will do this several times before it stops.
This has been such an annoying occurrence for us.  It started about 6 months after being installed about 2 years ago. I stopped using it for several months until yesterday. 
I wanted to start fresh so I deleted the app, re-Installed the program and the latest update. Guess what? Still the same issues!  
And while I did send an email to Kevo, I  have yet to receive a response. I hope my experience in an anomaly and you do not encounter these same issues.  
It is a wonderful concept when it works ad intended.

title: Wow!
text: I've had the Kevo for a little over a year. At first, it was ok.  Slowly but surly it gets better with updates.  Sometimes it lags and I have to unlock my phone and open the app and hold it right next to the lock to unlock the door. Now that the app lets you unlock the door without touching the app.....amazing.  I love that you can see if the door is locked or unlocked from the app. Hopefully with the new update the lag will be gone.  I am really thinking about buying the new plus so that I can unlock from anywhere.  Haven't decided yet.

title: Please FIX BUGS
text: Free EKeys are appreciated. However I would be happy to pay the eKey cost if the software would work better. Latest version broke adding notifications. Every time I try to add a notification it crashes the app on SAVE, with no changes. The current version (and some previous versions) of the App doesn't open the door unless you have the app open in the main screen. You also have to click through and select your lock even if you only have ONE Kevo lock. This adds up to a lot of time wasted among all the Kevo lock users just on my lock. Think about all users. PLEASE FIX THE BUGS. The Kevo app should also NOT have to have your location at all times. This is one of the reasons why users are reporting excessive battery drain. Please fix! 🙏

title: Love hate
text: I loves and hate this lock... Since the latest update with the gateway, I have had quiet a few issues with it... Such as the door locking up on its one without touching the lock or remotely locking it form the app, and other times it doesn't want to get activated or lock the door when you touch it... As much as I love the idea and the ability and versatility I get with this lock I tend to get frustrated at when I can't get it to function like it is intended to. Hoping the will soon have an update to fix those issues. If you can get past those issues you will like the flexibility and features offered by the kevo. They just need to fix the bugs

title: Only missing one thing.
text: We've been using this for about a week now and love, love, love it. Was easy to install and set up. Blends in really nice with our current door hardware. The 24 hour guest ekeys are handy and it's nice that there is no charge for them. My only complaint. I wish I could lock the door remotely from my phone. Would be super awesome if I could do it while away from the home but I would even settle for being able to do it from within the house. For those moments you've just snuggled into bed a think "did I lock the door when I let the dog out???" That would have earned it all 5 stars.

title: Works very well
text:
I installed Kevo 2 weeks ago and it has been working very well. There have only been a few times when it didn't unlock for me the first time I touch it. Usually because my iphone is in a pocket on the the far side of my body from the lock. I just turn my body and touch the lock again and it opens. 
Very convenient to share keys. From the outside it looks like a regular deadbolt so it doesn't attract any unwanted attention. 
I will give it 5 stars when they come out with an internet gateway. I would like to control the lock from the internet and view lock/unlock logs that way.

title: Stops working after every update
text:
Not to beat a dead horse, but like everyone else has said anytime there is any kind of iOS update kēvo loses some or all functionality. It was great when it first came out and has gone downhill ever since. Two months ago, functionality was just restored for iOS 10 and after a support ticket I had two delightful weeks of flawless usage before it being destroyed again by iOS 11. 

Kwikset: I realize that the issues arise after Apple updates, however you, like the entire world of App developers, receive AMPLE beta time to address these changes BEFORE a new version release. You should be ashamed for selling $200+ locks and you can’t be bothered to keep ONE APP DEVELOPER on standby for these entirely predictable maintenance issues? Seriously?

title: Great for kids, young and old.
text: Great for managing access and if someone happens to bring your child home whom you did not expect, you can send a key and allow access so your child can be delivered safely. As I foster older children/teens for short and long periods of time. When they transition out to another place, rather than change the locks continuously, I can delete keys, add keys, reissue keys which saves money on multiple locksmith visits. For late nights or is you loose your keys, you still can get in without fumbling in the dark. We love KEVO!

title: Used to work...shame
text: My wife and I bought this Kevo 2nd Gen a few months ago. It worked flawlessly for the first two or three months...then we noticed changes...Blue ring light spins round and round (I know have to bring my keys with me), the kevo app (iOS 11 version) still doesn’t work and shuts down on me every time I open it (using a 6s), having to restart the app and still, the app can not find the lock. Sometimes, I get lucky and the app will work, but to have this many issues, is this worth the price? If I could, i would take this product back and get myself a keypad lock or something else. Kwikset, please give me my money back, a 3rd gen lock that works with the app, I am done bending over

title: So much potential that it's painful to experience the limitations
text:
I just added Kevo Plus and I have no idea how my phone is talking to the lock or if it is actually talking to the lock. The gateway currently says my door is locked when I can clearly see it's not.

History is hit-and-miss. When someone locks the door, I generally get a notification that the door is locked. However, I rarely get notifications of the door unlocking. I think it's because the phone is switching from mobile data to WiFi but I can't imagine why it didn't occur to the product team that the message should be cached until it could be sent. How hard is that?

Two more crappy experiences that should not exist for a smart phone and a smart lock:

1. The lock should have enough brains to keep a log of key fob unlocks and sync that with the owner's phone when in range.

2. Removing a fob from the lock shouldn't require a complete clearing of the lock. Why do I need to re-add phones when I erase a fob?

I love the idea. I love the concept. I get the feeling that someone dismantled the development team as soon as the product was released.

title: Great but too many false lock activations
text:
[New Version Update] The new version brings some nice new features, but still does not fix the "accidental locking" flaw which occurs multiple times per day. Hopefully they will fix this soon with another software update.

Kevo is great, and does make life easier, but there is one big flaw: it is far, far too easy to accidentally trigger the lock to extend the bolt while the door is open, immediately making the "smart" lock seem dumb. This could be fixed in software (option to require three taps to lock, for example) but the team is very slow to respond to requests or add new features.

title: Apple Watch and locked notifications
text:
I like the user friendly interface, but I wish the updates of who goes in and when they go out was a little more detailed.  

I would like to see when that person comes in by a notification directly on the iPhone and not via email. 

I’d also like to see the same thing, but for when that person leaves which the app doesn’t have yet. 

If they could detail when someone goes in then out it would be very convenient. The app should also have totaled the amount of time that person was in the house for. 

Lastly I’m pretty disappointed that the Kēvo app doesn’t have an Apple Watch app.  The watch allows you to leave your phone at. There’s no risk losing it at big events, less things to carry when working out, discreetly have access to things during work, and so on.  However, because they lack an Apple Watch app I still have to take my iPhone with me so I can open the door which negates the accessibility of this app.

title: Cool lock
text: Seen mixed reviews for the last couple of weeks. Decides to check it out for myself. Bought the kevo system at bestbuy. Installed it in about 10-15 min. Had no issues pairing the fob and my smartphone. Lock seemed to work on command the first time each time. Other people I guess struggled. Glad I check it out for myself. Also you do not need to have the app open when trying to lock or unlock the system. I was looking all over for the answer because someone's review stated otherwise. That is false.

title: Bluetooth & Key Fob issues
text:
App/Bluetooth: I have the iPhone X and it worked great to unlock the door about 96% of the time on first try. That phone was stolen and upon getting my replacement the app works 0% to unlock the door. I’ve tried deleting and reinstalling the app with no success it still will not unlock the door. 🤷🏻‍♂️

Key Fob: With the replacement phone not unlocking the door and being stuck out of the house, I decided to buy & try the key fob. At first it worked pretty good, I’d say about 95% of the time on the first try. Then the battery died and since I replaced the battery with a new. It works about 80% of the time on the first try. Always seems to know when I have my hands full and that’s the 20% of the time it won’t unlock. 🤬

title: Disappointed, Would Not Buy Again
text:
The manufacturer has failed to properly support their product in a timely manner.  They don't prepare updates ahead of major IOS updates which then prevents the user from unlocking the lock with their phone.  This has happened with both IOS 10, and now again with IOS11.  

Overall i have found the lock to be unreliable, buggy, and in many instances have found myself standing outside my door wishing I had simply gotten my key out.  Many times I doubt whether the lock has actually locked when i'm leaving.  As a security and ease of use product it fails on both accounts.

The idea that underpins this product is a good one, however in this example it was poorly executed.

title: Kēvo is Unreliable
text:
I’ve had my Kēvo for several years now. Back when it first came out, it worked as intended. Throughout iOS 10, it simply did not work. Up until iOS 11.2, it has improved... enough for me to update my very negative review with one star. I’ve started using my Kēvo again. I’m uncertain the benefits that the second generation has; however, Kwikset certainly has not earned my trust in their products. In hindsight, I would recommend a smart lock that has a keypad and supports Z-Wave.

On one side note, I can’t stand how easy it is to bump the Kēvo and having the door lock on me by accident. I’d love to be able to set the Kēvo to only lock after three taps.

title: Completely agree w/ Reneeb518
text:
She summed up the lock and app exactly how I've been experiencing it.

The lock only works about 20% of the time.  The rest of the time I stand outside in the cold, like an idiot, waiting for the lock to open.  Usually, when I'm standing there, I find that the app has closed and I have to take the time out to open my phone, open the app, and even sometimes I have to manually open the lock.  I thank God my gf hasn't been to my place to see this or I'd never hear the end of it.

At first I thought it was a calibration issue.  Then I thought it was a battery issue.  But after reading the reviews I notice that this lock is just horrible.  For the price paid this app and lock definitely need a lot more work.

title: Great but I need more
text: Had the Kevo for about 1 month now and it's been working to perfection, no complaints! In the future I would like to see an advancement in this technology to be able to lock/unlock the bottom knob as well. I'm not comfortable only locking the top lock when gone for Long periods but when I need to make a short trip, I will just lock the top since my car is push to start as well...which is convenient for me to touch to get in. Also hopefully advancements will allow it to have a smaller back part so I can eventually add one to my screen door!!!

title: Life just got easier
text: Was intrigued at first. Growing up my family never locked the doors, but then when my wife started locking the deadbolt to our house I ended up face-planting myself into the door expecting it to be unlocked. Now with my phone in my pocket I don't ever have to worry. Especially helpful when you have your arms filled, and have already thrown your keys in your pocket. Not a single worry. Great product. No more keys! With 6 locked entrances to the house I will never have to wonder what key goes where again.

title: Great App, Needs Watch Support
text:
We've been using this lock and app for about 5 months. It's wonderful. The lock looks great, and it always feels like the future when I touch my lock to unlock it when I get home. Two things are making it lose a star:
1. In order for the lock to respond, you must always have the app open in the background. Not a big battery drain, but annoying if you're OCD about having apps closed. 
2. No Watch support. This is one of those things that would just make sense. With those two items gone, easily five stars.

title: So many missed opportunities
text: When working the app is fine. But most of the lock doesn’t read the phone from your pocket and you have to manually open the app, which is more of a pain than taking out a key. Additionally you have to manually close out of the app to prevent it from draining battery life. But the real disappointments are the missed opportunities for integration with other smart products. Not only is there not an Apple Watch app (a no-brainer for a concept like this) but it isn’t even compatible with Apple HomeKit. Why have a smart home product today that doesn’t match the capabilities of competitors and isn’t even compatible with rest of the ecosystem

title: Makes my life hell
text: I wish I could rate this system zero stars.. sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn’t.  App is always up to date but half the time the lock wont recognize my ekey. It’s supposed to make life easier but just complicates things.  I’m supposed to be able to have my bags in my hand and touch the lock and it unlocks, right? Nope.  I have to have the cell phone in my hand touching the lock with all my other apps closed, WiFi on and nothing else within a mile radius paired with the Bluetooth on my phone.  It’s shotty and horribly unreliable. Having a key lock was so much easier and I do not recommend this system to anyone wishing to keep their sanity. I’m sorry for the horrible review but these ekeys are not helping anyone.

title: Use to work
text:
The lock use to work when I bought it 2 years ago. Now the last 2 updates have actually made it worse. Doesn't work more then half the time. Must open app and it searches for a good 20 seconds to find the lock. Have to touch the lock multiple times and hope that it opens. Thinking about switching locks.

EDIT: I have actually had my kids locked out of the house more then a few times now. The lock is becoming worse and worse. Hardly works for my kids and I’ve been using my key, as it is ridiculous how long and how many times I have to hit the lock and hope it opens. 
I have actually ordered a different lock with a keypad because of how terrible this lock has performed!!

title: Terrible after latest "update".
text: Despite many complaints I went with Kevo and for many months it has work most of the time, if a bit slow. It might take 20-30 seconds after a tap to open but rarely more than one tap. Not only did the latest "update" sign out both our phones causing us to have to log back in just to get access, it has made the lock completely unreliable. Occasionally it will lock or unlock quickly but most times either it takes several taps and spinning lights, or more often I have to go in and open the app the unlock it manually. Terrible. Useless. I will be ditching this and going with a non-kwickset z-wave lock instead if this doesn't get corrected immediately.

title: Awful
text: I've had my Kēvo lock for over a year now and it worked great at first but shortly after has been nothing but a headache. I am typically standing out front of my door tapping my lock over and over for a couple minutes until it works. And now with the new update every time I go to use it I have to log in again. It's so bad that I have been forced to just use the physical key for it. This is such a great idea and when it works it's awesome. But it just doesn't seem ready for market. I honestly feel like I have a prototype. How has this thing been out for this long and cost this much and still doesn't work properly? Please fix the software so I can enjoy my experience with this lock before I just have to return it.

title: The lock
text: I've had it for about six months now and it seems to work OK if you have a problem you call up the number of support and they will walk you through the procedure I have it where I can unlock it with my smart phone and it seems to do good the batteries you can I need to upgrade to the highest they make becauuse it does use a lot of power but all in all it is great for not having keys or lease not using keys sometimes I leave the keys in the truck and I just use my smart phone

title: No customer support.
text:
I've had my kevo (2nd gen) for almost 6 months now, since the first week of having it, I called and emailed their support team and I have been calling every month since then with no answer, I strongly suggest not to buy from this company, I know I won't.

My problem is that when I do the setup process, after I name my lock an error message pops up saying I wasn't connected. I have tried the pair up process with 4 different phones, 3 iPhones (6s, 7, XR) and a Samsung (J3), same error shows. The device still works with that phone even with no key generated on the list, but its basically an overpriced deadbolt for every other family member.

Its a shame that this company does nothing for their customers.

title: Frustratingly inconsistent
text:
I really want to love this lock but it just doesn't let me.  It is terribly inconsistent with functionality which just kills any practicality we wanted to bring to our daily lives.

I've gone through various calibrations and reinstalls of the app. I'm on iOS 11.2.5 and still having consistent issues (have to bring app up, force close, and reopen for it to work).  Worst of all, obviously the app needs to be running in the background for it work. However, if it's running, it is constantly draining battery. If I check the Standby and Usage times in my settings, they are the same and, as soon as I close the app, it's back to normal.  This DRAINS my phone's battery.  This happens even WITH Power Save mode enabled.

title: This is awesome!
text:
Other reviews mentioned glitches, so I was worried, but kevo was the best option on the market. I would say the success rate is about 99% for opening and 100% for closing. (Good because if it doesn't open, it usually just takes a second try, but if I left the house and it didn't close, I wouldn't necessarily know until I returned later.)

I'm very happy with the app. 
The only thing I dislike is the extra fee for additional e-keys. This seems unnecessary on a $200+ lock, when the marginal cost for them to give out more keycodes is essentially 0.

title: Don't bother
text: Kevo continually gets worse with updates. Our fob no longer works. My husband gets logged out of the app every time I log in and vice versa. You have to keep it running in the background while logged in for it to work. I've been locked out of my house for a couple of hours at night when it wouldn't work. Customer service, of course, is only available during regular business hours. Always always carry a real key just in case. It would be nice if it could tell your phone/key was inside the house, so when going in and out if someone accidentally touched the lock it doesn't lock. That gets annoying. Not worth a penny we spent on this lock. Holding out for Apple to come out with home automation.

title: Much Better since update/calibrate
text:
I performed the calibration as per notification on update and the app works 100% better now. Will operate lock fairly consistently while in my pocket. So far so good. 

Previous review:
I have used this lock for several years now, always hoping the app would improve. My wife couldn’t deal with it, uses key. 
I have been very tolerant. I carry no key and have never been locked out of my home. It always worked, eventually. With iOS 11 it just doesn’t work. I am going to have to put the key back on my ring. 
My only complaint until now has been reliability. You never know if it will work or not. I pretty much try it once and go right to taking my phone out my pocket. It would always work after pulling up the app, only sometimes in background. 
Now, it is basically broken. Needs update ASAP or I may as well put back my old lock.

title: Good hardware, bad app
text:
Like my Kēvo, and have Kevo plus; the last year or two of the app, however, is basically hot garbage. Doesn't seem to stay open in the background reliably (or otherwise doesn't function in the background), often crashes to springboard when opening. Have been using since ~iPhone 4a or so, and have had every phone in between. App has been terrible since around my iPhone 6.

Plus functionality works well and is reliable, as is the Fob we have. This is with both a 1st gen and 2nd gen lock.

Also, where's my Watch app? My guess is Apple doesn't allow them the access they'd need to unlock via Bluetooth, but they could at least allow me to use my watch to unlock via kevo plus.
